question: What is the purpose of IPTables's "ipsets"?

answers.a: They group together IP addresses that are assigned to the same network interfaces.
answers.b: They group together IP addresses and networks that can be referenced by the network routing table.
answers.c: They group together IP addresses that can be referenced by netfilter rules.
answers.d: They group together IP and MAC addresses used by the neighbors on the local network.
answers.e: They group together IP addresses and user names that can be referenced from /etc/hosts.allow and /etc/hosts.deny

question: Linux Extended File Attributes are organized in namespaces. Which of the following names correspond to existing attribute namespaces? (Choose THREE correct answers.)
In which path is the data, which can be altered by the sysctl command, accessible?
Which DNS label points to the DANE information used to secure HTTPS connections to https://www.example.com?
What happens when the command getfattr afile is run while the file afile has no extended attributes set?

answers.a: getfattr prints a warning and exits with a values of 0.
answers.b: No output is produced and getfattr exits with a value of 0.
answers.c: getfattr prints a warning and exits with a value of 1.
answers.d: No outputs is produced and getfattr exits with a value of 1.

question: Given a proper network and name resolution setup, which of the following commands establishes a trust between a FreeIPA domain and an Active Directory domain?

answers.c: net ad ipa join addom –U Administrator -p

question: An X509 certificate contains the following information: X509v3 Basic Constraints: critical CA:TRUE, pathlen:0 Which of the following statements are true regarding the certificate? (Choose TWO correct answers.)

answers.a: This certificate may be used to sign certificates of subordinate certification authorities.
answers.b: This certificate belongs to a certification authority.
answers.c: This certificate may be used to sign end-entity certificates
answers.d: This certificate uses at least an 8096 bit private key length

question: Which of the following sections are allowed within the Kerberos configuration file krb5.conf? (Choose THREE correct answers.)
What effect does the configuration SSLStrictSNIVHostCheck on have on an Apache HTTPD virtual host?

answers.a: Despite its configuration, the virtual host is served only on the common name and Subject Alternative Names of the server certificates.
answers.b: The virtual host is used as a fallback default for all clients that do not support SNI.
answers.c: All of the names of the virtual host must be within the same DNS zone.
answers.d: The virtual host is served only to clients that support SNI.
answers.e: The clients connecting to the virtual host must provide a client certificate that was issued by the same CA that issued the server’s certificate.

question: How does TSIG authenticate name servers in order to perform secured zone transfers?

answers.a: Both servers mutually verify their X509 certificates.
answers.b: Both servers use a secret key that is shared between the servers.
answers.c: Both servers verify appropriate DANE records for the labels of the NS records used to delegate the transferred zone.
answers.d: Both servers use DNSSEC to mutually verify that they are authoritative for the transferred zone.

question: Which of the following database names can be used within a Name Service Switch (NSS) configuration file? (Choose TWO correct answers).
Which of the following command lines sets the administrator password for ntop to testing123?
What command is used to update NVTs from the OpenVAS NVT feed? (Specify ONLY the command without any path or parameters).
Which of the following lines in an OpenSSL configuration adds an X 509v3 Subject Alternative Name extension for the host names example.org and www.example.org to a certificate'?
Which of the following information, within a DNSSEC-signed zone, is signed by the key signing key?

answers.a: The non-DNSSEC records like A, AAAA or MX
answers.b: The zone signing key of the zone.
answers.c: The RRSIG records of the zone.
answers.d: The NSEC or NSEC3 records of the zone.
answers.e: The DS records pointing to the zone

question: Which of the following commands displays all ebtable rules contained in the table filter including their packet and byte counters?
Which of the following access control models is established by using SELinux?
What is the purpose of the program snort-stat?

answers.a: It displays statistics from the running Snort process.
answers.b: It returns the status of all configured network devices.
answers.c: It reports whether the Snort process is still running and processing packets.
answers.d: It displays the status of all Snort processes.
answers.e: It reads syslog files containing Snort information and generates port scan statistics.

question: Which of the following methods can be used to deactivate a rule in Snort? (Choose TWO correct answers.)

answers.a: By placing a # in front of the rule and restarting Snort
answers.b: By placing a pass rule in local.rules and restarting Snort.
answers.c: By deleting the rule and waiting for Snort to reload its rules files automatically.
answers.d: By adding a pass rule to /etc/snort/rules.deactivated and waiting for Snort to reload its rules files automatically.

question: When OpenVPN sends a control packet to its peer, it expects an acknowledgement in 2 seconds by default. Which of the following options changes the timeout period to 5 seconds?
Which command revokes ACL-based write access for groups and named users on the file afile?
Which of the following statements are true regarding the certificate of a Root CA? (Choose TWO correct answers.)

answers.b: It does not include the private key of the CA
answers.c: It must contain a host name as the common name.
answers.d: It has an infinite lifetime and never expires.
answers.e: It must contain an X509v3 Authority extension.

question: Which of the following statements are valid wireshark capture filters? {Choose TWO correct answers.)
Which of the following commands adds a new user usera to FreelPA?

answers.b: idap-useradd -H ldaps://ipa-server CN=UserA --attribs "Firstname: User: Lastname: A"
answers.c: ipa-admin create user --account usera -fname User –iname A

question: Which option of the openvpn command should be used to ensure that ephemeral keys are not written to the swap space?
Which of the following statements is used in a parameter file for setkey in order to create a new SPD entry?
Which of the following terms refer to existing scan techniques with nmap? (Choose TWO correct answers.)
Which of the following commands makes the contents of the eCryptfs encrypted directory ~/Private available to the user?
Which of the following openssl commands generates a certificate signing request (CSR) using the already existing private key contained in the file private/keypair.pem?
Which of the following expressions are valid AIDE rules? (Choose TWO correct answers.)
Which command included in the Linux Audit system provides searching and filtering of the audit log?
Which of the following are differences between AppArmor and SELinux? (Choose TWO correct answers).

answers.a: AppArmor is implemented in user space only. SELinux is a Linux Kernel Module.
answers.b: AppArmor is less complex and easier to configure than SELinux.
answers.c: AppArmor neither requires nor allows any specific configuration. SELinux must always be manually configured.
answers.d: SELinux stores information in extended file attributes. AppArmor does not maintain file specific information and states.
answers.e: The SELinux configuration is loaded at boot time and cannot be changed later on AppArmor provides user space tools to change its behavior.

question: Which of the following commands defines an audit rule that monitors read and write operations to the file/ etc/firewall/rules and associates the rule with the name firewall?

answers.e: echo 'n: firewall r:/etc/firewall/rules: w:/ etc/firewall/rules:' | auditctl ~

question: Which of the following DNS record types can the command dnssec-signzone add to a zone? (Choose THREE correct answers.)
Which of the following parameters to openssl s_client specifies the host name to use for TLS Server Name Indication?
Which of the following types can be specified within the Linux Audit system? (Choose THREE correct answers)
Which of the following statements describes the purpose of ndpmon?

answers.a: It monitors the network for neighbor discovery messages from new IPv6 hosts and routers
answers.b: It monitors remote hosts by periodically sending echo requests to them.
answers.c: It monitors the availability of a network link by querying network interfaces.
answers.d: It monitors the network for IPv4 nodes that have not yet migrated to IPv6.
answers.e: It monitors log files for failed login attempts in order to block traffic from offending network nodes

question: Which of the following commands adds users using SSSD’s local service?
Which of the following authentication methods was added to NFS in version 4?
Which of the following statements is true about chroot environments?

answers.a: Symbolic links to data outside the chroot path are followed, making files and directories accessible
answers.b: Hard links to files outside the chroot path are not followed, to increase security
answers.c: The chroot path needs to contain all data required by the programs running in the chroot environment
answers.d: Programs are not able to set a chroot path by using a function call, they have to use the command chroot
answers.e: When using the command chroot, the started command is running in its own namespace and cannot communicate with other processes

question: What option of mount.cifs specifies the user that appears as the local owner of the files of a mounted CIFS share when the server does not provide ownership information? (Specify ONLY the option name without any values or parameters.)
Which directive is used in an OpenVPN server configuration in order to send network configuration information to the client? (Specify ONLY the option name without any values or parameters.)
This file must be sent to a CA in order to receive a signed certificate back from the CA.
Which of the following lines is the appropriate configuration to use when adding a subject alternative name for the hostnames example.com and www.example.com to a certificate?
Which command is used to generate a CSR file?
How can a user authenticate a website using a signed certificate?

answers.a: By verifying the certificate with the signing CA.
answers.c: By verifying the certificate with the intermediary.
answers.d: By verifying the chain of trust.

question: Which directive is used by mod_ssl to determine the ciphers allowed for use in HTTPS communication?
What is normally delivered with each TLS update? (Choose TWO correct answers.)
Which of the following statements is true regarding eCryptfs?

answers.a: When a user changes their login password, the contents of their eCryptfs home directory has to be re-encrypted using their new login password.
answers.b: After unmounting an eCryptfs directory, the directory hierarchy and the original file names are still visible, although, it is not possible to view the contents of the files.
answers.c: eCryptfs does not support PAM integration.
answers.d: eCryptfs cannot be used to encrypt raw devices.

How are SELinux permissions related to standard Linux permissions?

answers.a: SELinux permissions are verified before standard linux permissions.
answers.b: SELinux permissions are verified after standard linux permissions.
answers.c: SELinux permissions override standard Linux permissions
answers.d: Standard Linux permissions override SELinux permissions.
